awd_titl_txt: Undergraduate Biotechnology Laboratory for Chemical         Engineering Students
awd_abstract_narration: A growing trend in chemical engineering curricula in the past                   decade has been the introduction of biochemical engineering                     into undergraduate laboratory courses. A biotechnology                          laboratory that incorporates studies in microbial fermentation                  kinetics, enzymology, biochemical reactor analysis, and                         bioseparation techniques is included in the chemical                            engineering curriculum to acquaint undergraduates with these                    important experimental methods. Equipment in this laboratory                    includes a batch/continuous fermenter, an ultrafiltration                       system, chromatography and spectrophotometry units, and devices                 to monitor cell growth such as densitometers and dissolved                      oxygen and pH probes. Such a laboratory exposes undergraduate                   students in chemical engineering to many important aspects of                   the new and emerging technology that biotechnology represents.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: COOPER UNION FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF SCIENCE & ART
